metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23982 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Using techniques that built on the slipstream research, a malicious webpagecould have scanned both an internal network's hosts as well as servicesrunning on the user's local machine utilizing WebRTC connections. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird <78.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
